issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
With 4.1 the VPC implementation would require users to have eucanetd package installed on the CLC host. 

Currently the eucanetd package brings following dependencies with it for example:

{code}
# yum install eucanetd
Loaded plugins: fastestmirror, security
Loading mirror speeds from cached hostfile

Transaction Summary
==========================================================================================================================================================================
Install      75 Package(s)

Total download size: 23 M
Installed size: 70 M
Is this ok [y/N]:
{code}

If the user does not want to have cloud-in-a-box setup these packages does not make sense for him to have on a non-NC machine. 

Can we please look at removing NC as hard dependency in eucanetd that caused all these packages getting pulled?

From the spec file:
{code}

%package -n eucanetd
Summary:        Eucalyptus cloud platform - edge networking daemon
License:        GPLv3
Group:          Applications/System

Requires:       %{name}-nc = %{version}-%{release}
Requires:       dhcp >= 4.1.1-33.P1
Requires:       ebtables
Requires:       ipset
Requires:       iptables
Requires:       /usr/bin/which

%provide_abi eucanetd

Obsoletes:      eucalyptus-eucanet < 4.0

%description -n eucanetd
Eucalyptus is a service overlay that implements elastic computing
using existing resources. The goal of Eucalyptus is to allow sites
with existing clusters and server infrastructure to co-host an elastic
computing service that is interface-compatible with Amazon AWS.
{code}

We might want to remove

{code}
Requires:       %{name}-nc = %{version}-%{release}
{code}

Hope this is useful. Let me know if you have any questions.
fields.summary: remove eucalyptus-nc as dep for eucanetd

comments.body: Fixed in eucalyptus-rpmspec commit {{90e36e9}}.  In the next build this dependency should be reversed.
